repnme.cdata!:
Costa Rica - Atlantico Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Atlantico
            Agricultural Development Project is assessed as marginally
            unsatisfactory with a likely sustainability. On the positive
            side, the development objective of increasing export crops
            in the Atlantic region was achieved, and the land titling
            and rural roads programs provided considerable benefits to
            the farmers and others in the project area. However,
            excessive delays in project implementation occurred. The
            following lessons were learned: a) The design of
            agricultural development projects to support significant
            technology change must include clear methodological
            indicators and a work program for technology extension,
            together with the budgeting of the resources required. B) In
            projects where credit is a fundamental development
            instrument, it is important to fully involve the
            participating bank in the process of project preparation, in
            order to develop ownership and discover and address possible
            implementation problems. C) The institutional implementation
            capacity of all involved entities should be carefully
            evaluated, especially for rural roads components. D) The
            execution of activities with active community participation
            can result in considerable efficiencies and cost savings.

Costa Rica - Atlantico Agricultural

repnme.cdata!:
Costa Rica - Atlantico Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the proposed
            project is to expand the production of agricultural exports
            in support of the Government's economic recovery and
            structural adjustment program. In order to achieve its
            principal objective, the proposed project would: (a) provide
            agricultural credit for financing the development of
            selected export crops, including rehabilitation or
            replanting of about 4,500 ha and new planting about 2,500 ha
            of cocoa. It would, furthermore, (b) improve about 104 km of
            rural roads; (c) issue about 1,500 land titles; (d) provide
            technical assistance to farmers; and (e) strengthen project
            administration. Under the overall coordination of the
            Ministry of Planning and Economic Policy (MIDEPLAN), the
            project would be implemented by the following agencies: the
            Banco Nacional de Costa Rica, or BNCR (credit); the Ministry
            of Public Works and Transportation (roads); and the Agrarian
            Development Institute (titling).

repnme.cdata!:
Costa Rica - Atlantico Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the proposed
            project is to expand the production of agricultural exports
            in support of the Government's economic recovery and
            structural adjustment program.  In order to achieve its
            principal objective, the proposed project would:  (a)
            provide agricultural credit for financing the development of
            selected export crops, including rehabilitation or
            replanting of about 4,500 ha and new planting about 2,500 ha
            of cocoa.  It would, furthermore, (b) improve about 104 km
            of rural roads; (c) issue about 1,500 land titles; (d)
            provide technical assistance to farmers; and (e) strengthen
            project administration.  Under the overall coordination of
            the Ministry of Planning and Economic Policy (MIDEPLAN), the
            project would be implemented by the following agencies:  the
            Banco Nacional de Costa Rica, or BNCR (credit); the Ministry
            of Public Works and Transportation (roads); and the Agrarian
            Development Institute (titling).
